tweets.html:
ESPN should make a show starring Skip Bayless as a cop who makes criminals confess rather than hear him talk more about Tim Tebow.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) November 23, 2011

Another Justified S3 promo: http://t.co/zi8Lj5jb. Didn't know Loretta is now on Last Man Standing. Hasn't she suffered enough?

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) November 23, 2011

@crsbecker I'm convincing myself that the promo is about Raylan & Boyd charging forward to rescue her from Last Man Standing.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) November 23, 2011

Is it weird that a lifetime of TV has made me wish I was spending the holiday with a collection of stranded friends instead of my family?

— Jeverett15 (@jeverett15) November 23, 2011

Kim Kardashian makes me long for the days when girls like her were hired to show prizes on game shows and we never had to hear them speak.

— kelly oxford (@kellyoxford) November 23, 2011

Loving this new "Money Hoarders" show. Oh wait, it's just CNBC.

— Miles Kahn (@mileskahn) November 23, 2011

My favorite part about smart phones is a tie between holding evil cops accountable and the proliferation of Muppet videos.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) November 23, 2011

After my incendiary Dancing With The Stars comments last night, all my future tweets will now be generated by Ashton Kutcher's publicist.

— Shawn Ryan (@ShawnRyanTV) November 23, 2011

Just realized this is 1st Christmas without Favorite Things telling me what to want. Oh, Oprah, how I miss the way you shopped for America!

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) November 23, 2011

It's not the same without shrieking audience and paramedics on standby. Sigh. RT @Allison_Rob She does have Favorite Things in magazine

— shonda rhimes (@shondarhimes) November 23, 2011

Sorry, but 3 random people over 3 years saying Beetlejuice's name won't summon Beetlejuice. #CommunityGrinch

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) November 23, 2011

@HitFixDaniel Now you're just being a monster.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) November 23, 2011

Way to ruin everyone's fun RT @HitFixDaniel: Sorry, 3 people over 3 years saying Beetlejuice's name wont summon Beetlejuice #CommunityGrinch

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) November 23, 2011

Absolutely true fact: Growing up watching the Swedish Chef, I thought he was hilarious, and never noticed he had real hands.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) November 23, 2011

Today in 1888, Harpo Marx was born. He's known for his inspirational quote, "(honk) (whistle) (hoonnnnnk). (honk)." It's still true today.

— Disalmanac (@Disalmanac) November 23, 2011

I love how the characters in #Glee treat the Irish kid like he's from deepest, darkest Africa. #ByLoveIMeanHate

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) November 23, 2011

it's silly, but one of my favorite details about TVD is that the women usually wear flat shoes. hell yeah. makes sense in the Hellmouth 2

— D(oc) Oc(k) (@frittersandclam) November 23, 2011

Logline for #Parenthood: An extended family of handsome people can't stop themselves from being jackasses. The world suffers until they hug.

— Nick Campbell (@sononick) November 23, 2011

48 years ago DOCTOR WHO premiered on the BBC. 48 years ago JFK was assassinated. Guess which one dominated my Twitter feed today?

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) November 23, 2011

UPN WEDNESDAY! Willie Aames and Kirk Cameron guest on the special A DINOSAUR THANKSGIVING at 8/7c; then all-new STAR TREK: CSI at 9/8c. #upn

— UPN (@upntweets) November 23, 2011

Wait Wait, Don't Tell Eric Roberts. Please. For The Love Of God. Just Don't Do It. #PublicRadioShowsModifiedForEricRoberts

— John Moe (@johnmoe) November 23, 2011

Howard Stern in talks for #AmericasGotTalent? Expect next year's winner to have a curious trick involving ping pong balls, then.

— Dan Owen (@danowen79) November 23, 2011

I try not to swear here much but: dear all TV commercials trying to make me conflate my love of my child with your product, fuck you forever

— The Mountain Goats (@mountain_goats) November 23, 2011

There needs to be a booze version of a turducken. And then someone needs to bring that to me.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) November 23, 2011

@TVMcGee if such a thing exists, I'm sure Ron Swanson knows how to make it, and could carve you a stein to drink it from. #RonSwansonFacts

— Mo Ryan (@moryan) November 23, 2011

There are two kinds of people in this world: people who quote Airplane, and morons.

— Lizzie O'Leary (@lizzieohreally) November 24, 2011

General Hospital is being purposefully dismantled, #AMC and #OLTL will likely die and/or stay dead. Brian Frons is still stacking checks.

— Jamey_Giddens (@Jamey_Giddens) November 23, 2011

My mother will have a happier Thanksgiving w/o the worry of having to figure out how to watch "All My Children" online, I suppose.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) November 23, 2011

There's only one way to save the soaps now. "Tyler Perry's All My Children."

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) November 24, 2011

I will give some money to Wikipedia. As long as that guy on the front page promises not to deal meth to my kids.

— AJ Jacobs (@ajjacobs) November 24, 2011

Today Twitter suggested I follow Dane Cook and Kim Kardashian. Hey, Twitter, I suggest you follow @gofyourself & @dieinafire

— Robert Hewitt Wolfe (@writergeekrhw) November 24, 2011

I don't remember Charlie Brown using the phrase "a handful of cocks," but there it is at the :20 mark. http://t.co/EKKwUjbC

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) November 24, 2011

@mattzollerseitz Wow. Schroeder was the one who tweaked my gaydar. Besides Peppermint Patty and that weird chick who called her 'sir.'

— Peter Ames Carlin (@peteramescarlin) November 24, 2011

I lost track on who the detective is on L&O Criminal Intent. Is it still Pee Wee Herman?

— Len MacKeigan (@lenmac1) November 24, 2011

Oh GOD Steve Jones. Stop touching Howie Mandel's shoulder. YOU'RE KILLING HIM!

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) November 24, 2011

These Heineken commercials are so well made, that I wish they didn't exist to sell Heineken.

— Josh A. Cagan (@joshacagan) November 24, 2011

I'm watching #Suburgatory for the first time. I have no idea what's going on.

— Notorious RBF (@stringertheory) November 24, 2011

Attraction of "Biggest Loser: Where Are They?" would be more accurately reflected in the title, "Are They Fat Again?"

— Ken Pisani (@kpsmartypants) November 24, 2011

There should be an app that alerts you if something ever happens on Walking Dead. Wanna delete backlog of episodes, but what if? WHAT IF?

— Erin Hill (@ErinHill2) November 24, 2011

Rob Riggle is oddly good at playing "that guy." #HappyEndings @happywrites

— Tim (@rural_juror) November 24, 2011

I like to believe there is a person who works out of a broom cupboard at USA whose sole job is to think up #NCIS marathon titles.

— Notorious RBF (@stringertheory) November 24, 2011

Wait, is this that Modern Family episode where Mitch undercuts Cam, and Cam gets sorta pissy? I think I've seen this one.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) November 24, 2011

The gay couple on MODERN FAMILY spend Thanksgiving bickering...just like every other day of the year.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) November 24, 2011

In an all-new Modern Family, Jay thinks Gloria is too attentive to Manny, Claire stifles Phil's goofiness, and Cameron annoys Mitchell!

— Brandon 🚷 (@bnowalk) November 24, 2011

My dentist told me to stop watching #modernfamily because all that sugary sweetness is murdering my teeth. #CueTheFullHouseMusic

— John Lowe™ (@TheJohnLoweShow) November 24, 2011

"Ugh, Tyler!" -- entire family, in unison. Clearly, Ashton Holmes is doing something very right. #revenge

— tierney bricker (@tbrick2) November 24, 2011

When does Emily get REVENGE on Mother Nature? This is the least-sunny Hamptons EVER.

— Matt Mitovich (@MattMitovich) November 24, 2011

Nolan is on FIRE tonight. Even his snarks have snarks. #Revenge

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) November 24, 2011

(That made no sense.)

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) November 24, 2011

tweets.author_name: Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison
tweets.html:
OH NO SHE DIDN'T. #Revenge

— Austin Morris, Real Housewife of Madison (@austindotTV) November 24, 2011

I am amazed such a smart, scandalous, raunchy show is actually airing on network TV. #Revenge

— Jamey_Giddens (@Jamey_Giddens) November 24, 2011

Oh, #Revenge. How I love you so.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) November 24, 2011

#Revenge is a parade of fake smiles, and I love it.

— Vlada Gelman (@VladaGelman) November 24, 2011

If I wrote a review on Revenge, it would be entitled "A Very Confused Man Tries To Review Revenge"

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) November 24, 2011

You guys, #Revenge is really convinced in the convincingness of its green screen landscape on Emily porch. #IAmLessConvinced

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) November 24, 2011

YOU GUYS SHE HAS A SENSEI. #Revenge

— Myles McNutt (@Memles) November 24, 2011

I wish they would've made the cast of #Revenge black. We snatch wigs and take names. Its just what we do. #StereoTypeCasting

— John Lowe™ (@TheJohnLoweShow) November 24, 2011

#Revenge feels like a porno flick without the porn. Move this shit to HBO and let me see some spankin! #HumpingInTheHamptons

— John Lowe™ (@TheJohnLoweShow) November 24, 2011

I've never sat through a full "Survivor" clip show before. I'm now remembering why that's been the casezzzz.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) November 24, 2011

Holy shit, American Horror Story. Gimme a second helping of weird on top of the crazy.

— Chris (@MrNoncents) November 24, 2011

Imma need for Connie Britton to start kicking some ghost ass soon. This needs to happen. #AHS

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) November 24, 2011

Can't believe who was inside the rubber suit on "American Horror Story" -- Dr. Christian Troy from "Nip/Tuck"!

— Roger Catlin (@rcatlin) November 24, 2011

Only now is it dawning on me (and for no reason) how colossal a shitshow Twitter would've been on Nip/Tuck nights, had it been around then.

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) November 24, 2011

Says a lot about #AHS that it took me about 15 secs to summarize prior plot for spouse tonight. "Those ones are dead. Those ones are alive."

— Chris Becker (@crsbecker) November 24, 2011

These ghosts must really get sick of each other. It's like Thanksgiving dinner with family you can't get away from every.single.day. #AHS

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) November 24, 2011

A Gaga Thanksgiving? She always struck me as more of a New Years girl. Or maybe Earth Day.

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) November 24, 2011
